root: ^If you were looking for a place to sit in here, there isn't one.
^That's okay, just passing through the cars.
^I'm moving to the city and so had to bring all my stuff.
^Oh that's cool! You've got a lot of stuff.
^Yeah I'm not even sure all of it is going to fit in my new apartment.
^You do have a lot of stuff, maybe you can sell some of it?
^I wouldn’t think of getting rid of any of it.
^I have the clothes my friends gifted me.
^My dad lent me some of his favourite old books.
^Both of my cousins were throwing away a chair and a couch and so I needed that.
^I can’t really get rid of any of it.
^If it’s a lot of second-hand stuff, what's wrong with getting new things?
^It’s not really about getting new stuff, it’s the stuff I got.
^All these things were given to me by friends and family.
^Each little piece of it reminds me of home. So I want to bring as much of home with me as possible.
^Who knows what living in the city will be like and how much I’ll be able to visit.
^I’ll at least have these small pieces of home with me.
^Oh, aw. That’s nice. You’ll have plenty of mementos of home!
^If I’m surrounded by things given to me by the people I love, I’m hoping I won’t ever feel homesick at all.
^I hope you don’t and I hope your new place becomes its own special home with time too.
